wikipedia_page.main: Claude Thomas Stanfield Moore (1 June 1853 – 2 April 1901) was a British artist from Nottingham who flourished from 1876 until his death in 1901. He was initially a landscape artist, but became better known for his maritime scenes and views over the Thames.

response: This page should redirect the enquirer to "Claude Thomas Stanfield Moore", where there is some information about his father, Thomas Cooper.
This page should redirect the enquirer to "Claude Thomas Stanfield Moore", where there is some information about his brother, Reuben Arthur, more commonly known as Rubens Arthur Moore.
